text:
Oil & Natural Gas Corporation Ltd. (ONGC) is expected to deliver a steady October to December quarter as the benefits of higher crude prices is likely to be negated by lower domestic gas prices.India’s biggest energy explorer’s revenue is expected to rise to Rs 19,394 crore, an increase of 6 percent compared to the July to September quarter, according to to the consensus estimate of 20 analysts tracked by Bloomberg.Net profit is expected to decline 3 percent to Rs 4,836 crore as the rise in crude prices were offset by the cut in domestic gas prices. Earnings before interest, tax, depreciation, and amortisation is expected to rise 8.7 percent to Rs 9,892 crore.
















Net realisation is seen rising five percent to $50.5 per barrel on the back of rising crude oil prices, while the oil and gas volumes are expected to remain flat quarter-on-quarter, according to brokerages including Jefferies and Motilal Oswal.
title: Will ONGC Surprise The Street For The Sixth Quarter In A Row?
